docs.lead_paragraph: With all the hoopla over the health care bill, hardly anybody noticed that a job creation bill that President Obama signed on March 18 makes it much harder for United States citizens to avoid taxes by hiding money in overseas bank accounts.

headline.main: Death of a Loophole, and Swiss Banks Will Mourn

docs.abstract: In the new jobs bill, Congress has taken aim at financial institutions that hide information about offshore accounts.
docs.snippet: In the new jobs bill, Congress has taken aim at financial institutions that hide information about offshore accounts.

docs.lead_paragraph: PORTLAND, Me. -- Even in Representative Chellie Pingree's liberal district in southern Maine, the celebration was tempered. At a reception and dinner here promoting gay rights on Saturday night, a revolving door of well-wishers -- mostly liberals and mainstream Democrats -- shook Ms. Pingree's hand and thanked her for backing President Obama's health care bill.

headline.main: Six Districts, Two Sides, One Weekend: The Unabashed Liberal

docs.abstract: Rep Chellie Pingree, Democrat from Maine, greets well-wishers at reception and dinner in Portland following her vote for health care bill as primary election nears; photo (M)
docs.snippet: PORTLAND, Me. -- Even in Representative Chellie Pingree's liberal district in southern Maine, the celebration was tempered.      At a reception and dinner here promoting gay rights on Saturday night, a revolving door of well-wishers -- mostly...

docs.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS -- Welcome to the Bizarro World of health care politics. In this world, a Republican congressman explains his vote against the health care bill to a disappointed constituency by pointing out that he voted for and still prefers the original House version -- which was, in many ways, more liberal than what eventually passed. And, he adds, do not forget that his votes have aligned with President Obama nearly 70 percent of the time.

headline.main: Six Districts, Two Sides, One Weekend: The Political Anomaly

docs.abstract: Rep Anh Cao, Louisiana Republican from, explains why he voted against final health care bill to disapppointed constituency during job fair in New Orleans before primary election; photo (M)
docs.snippet: NEW ORLEANS -- Welcome to the Bizarro World of health care politics.     In this world, a Republican congressman explains his vote against the health care bill to a disappointed constituency by pointing out that he voted for and still prefers the...

docs.lead_paragraph: SPARTA, Ga. -- A white man had just finished thanking Representative John Barrow for his vote against the health care bill when Walter A. Collins rose to respectfully disagree. ''I find your vote on health care very disturbing,'' Mr. Collins, 72, a black retiree, politely told Mr. Barrow, a centrist third-term Democrat. ''When you voted no, I really wanted to cry.''

headline.main: Six Districts, Two Sides, One Weekend: The Man in the Middle

docs.abstract: Rep John Barrow, Democrat from Georgia who voted against health care bill, is commended by white voters and criticized by black ones as he faces constituents in Sparta before primary against black opponent; photo (M)
docs.snippet: SPARTA, Ga. -- A white man had just finished thanking Representative John Barrow for his vote against the health care bill when Walter A. Collins rose to respectfully disagree.     ''I find your vote on health care very disturbing,'' Mr. Collins, 72,...

docs.lead_paragraph: ORLANDO, Fla. -- Representative Alan Grayson could have headed straight for the sign that said ''Health Care Hero.'' Instead, he held back, smiling and bouncing in his zippered size 13 boots, letting the cheers crescendo like Bruce Springsteen before an encore. When Mr. Grayson, a first-term Democrat, reached the 75 supporters awaiting him at the airport here on Friday, he was unabashedly triumphant. ''It's not enough to be No. 1 in your military expenditures, it's not enough to be No. 1 in the number of countries around the would that you occupy,'' he said. ''We have to be No. 1 in health care.''

headline.main: Six Districts, Two Sides, One Weekend: The Vulnerable Victor

docs.abstract: Rep Alan Grayson, Florida Democrat who voted in favor of health care reform legislation, greets supporters at airport in Orlando before primary; photo (M)
